info.game_comments:
2005 Ultimate Tournament of Champions Round 2, game 1.

(Sergeant: Fall in!  Report!--to watch clues from Parris Island on Jeopardy!)

jeopardy_round: A DAY'S CALORIES IN ONE MEAL

(1, 1).clue: Biscayne National Park is a water park in the southern part of this state

(2, 1).clue: He also hosted the game shows "Earn Your Vacation" & "Who Do You Trust?"

(3, 1).clue: This "A Tramp Abroad" author opined, "Wagner's music is better than it sounds"

(4, 1).clue: Double Whopper with cheese, King fries, large vanilla shake, Dutch apple pie

(6, 1).clue: Arnold spent his first hour at work enjoying a latte & "twiddling" these, aka the pollices

(1, 2).clue: A Naval air station in the city of Lakehurst in this state was the site of the fateful 1937 Hindenburg explosion

(2, 2).clue: He is scheduled to take over the hosting duties in 2009

(3, 2).clue: "I am extraordinarily patient, provided I get my own way in the end", said this British "Iron Lady"

(4, 2).clue: Zesty Chicken Border Bowl, Fiesta Taco Salad, Nachos Bellgrande, apple empanada

(6, 2).clue: The boss held these "akimbo" while demanding to know why Arnold was late again

(1, 3).clue: Part of a state that seceded from the U.S. in 1861 seceded to form this state in 1863

(2, 3).clue: He walked off in the middle of the telecast after the network censored his "water closet" joke

(3, 3).clue: In 2005, shortly after announcing her engagement (after a 35-year affair), she said, "I'm just coming down to Earth"

(4, 3).clue: Market Fresh Roast Beef & Swiss sandwich, large Jalapeno Bites, Jamocha shake

(6, 3).clue: Arnold "shrugged" these while trying to come up with an excuse

(1, 4).clue: The 6 states that border this state are Texas, New Mexico, Arkansas, Missouri, Kansas & Colorado

(2, 4).clue: He was married to Jayne Meadows

(3, 4).clue: "A fool and his money are soon elected", said this humorist who died in 1935

(4, 4).clue: 2 large orders of popcorn chicken, 2 biscuits, potato wedges, BBQ beans, Lil' Bucket lemon creme, large Pepsi

(1, 5).clue: New Castle was this mid-Atlantic state's first capital

(2, 5).clue: This glum-faced comic born Joseph Gottlieb guest hosted the show more than 150 times in the '60s & '70s

(3, 5).clue: From his "Devil's Dictionary": "Diplomacy, n. The patriotic art of lying for one's country"

(4, 5).clue: 2 Big Bacon Classics, great Biggie fries, Homestyle Chicken Strips Salad with ranch dressing, medium Frosty

(6, 5).clue: At quitting time Arnold "barked" one of these against a wastebasket in his mad dash for the door

(1, 1).clue: The D.C. house he lived in after he left office in 1921 is called "Washington's only presidential museum"

(2, 1).clue: 1485 Florence was shocked by this artist's large nude painting of the birth of a goddess

(3, 1).clue: Metaphorically, you "push" it when you react in haste; you can use an actual one to summon police

(5, 1).clue: She played little Virginia Cary in 1935's "The Littlest Rebel"

(6, 1).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew reports from Parris Island, SC.)  Very quickly after you arrive at Parris Island, you'll meet this person, the D.I.

(1, 2).clue: Somewhat prophetically, he became the first sitting president to visit Hawaii

(2, 2).clue: His mural at Rockefeller Center was destroyed because it included a depiction of Lenin

(3, 2).clue: He won back-to-back Olympic gold medals in figure skating in 1948 & 1952

(6, 2).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew reports from Parris Island, SC.)  Marine training instills this motto, meaning "always faithful"

(1, 3).clue: He & his wife translated into English "De Re Metallica", a 16th century Latin work on mining

(2, 3).clue: In 1892 Berlin authorities screamed & closed the exhibit by this Scandinavian artist

(3, 3).clue: Bob Hope sang this Oscar-winning song in 1948's "The Paleface"

(5, 3).clue: Wise beyond her years, she's the scene-stealing co-star of "Uptown Girls" and "Hide and Seek"

(6, 3).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew reports from Parris Island, SC.)  Marines are taught to see themselves as part of a team, like this basic unit of 30 to 50 people

(1, 4).clue: In 1893 James K. Polk's tomb was moved from his estate to the state capitol grounds in this city

(2, 4).clue: This impressionist's Christ paintings of 1864 & 1865 were crucified for being unidealized

(3, 4).clue: The cornflower, a plant with small round flowers, is also known as this

(5, 4).clue: As Samuel Lapp, he was the witness in 1985's "Witness"

(6, 4).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew reports from Parris Island, SC.)  A lot of Marine vocabulary comes from the Navy: doors are hatches, while windows & eyeglasses are both called these

(1, 5).clue: He became pres. 100 years after George Washington, so he was called the "Centennial President"

(2, 5).clue: Marcel Duchamp's "Nude Descending a Staircase" caused a stir at this 1913 show in New York City

(3, 5).clue: In 1927 one of this 18th century American's autographs sold for over $50,000

(5, 5).clue: The title kid in 1948's "The Boy with Green Hair"

(6, 5).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew reports from Parris Island, SC.)  From the Latin for "boxer", it's the variety of training weapon these Marines are using to practice combat fighting

(0, 0).clue: As a foe of the Spanish, he's been called "The Queen's Pirate" & a "Gran Luterano"
